definitions.text: (mathematics) a mathematical relation such that each element of a given set (the domain of the function) is associated with an element of another set (the range of the function)

examples: the function of an auger is to bore holes
ballet is beautiful but what use is it?

definitions.text: the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group
examples: the function of a teacher
the government must do its part
play its role

definitions.text: a relation such that one thing is dependent on another
examples: height is a function of age
price is a function of supply and demand

definitions.text: a formal or official social gathering or ceremony
examples: it was a black-tie function
the party was quite an affair
an occasion arranged to honor the president
a seemingly endless round of social functions

definitions.text: a set sequence of steps, part of larger computer program

examples: The washing machine won't go unless it's plugged in
Does this old car still run well?
This old radio doesn't work anymore

definitions.text: serve a purpose, role, or function
examples: The tree stump serves as a table
The female students served as a control group
This table would serve very well
His freedom served him well
The table functions as a desk

definitions.text: perform duties attached to a particular office or place or function
examples: His wife officiated as his private secretary
